alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Cheshire; Merrimack; Southern Carroll; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 12 at 12:12PM EST until March 12 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW EXPECTED TODAY... .Low pressure near the Mid Atlantic coastline continues to rapidly intensify as it races northeast through the Gulf of Maine this afternoon. Heavy snowfall and snowfall rates of greater than 1 inch per hour are expected in the warning area. Rain changing to a wet snow will lead to slippery travel conditions in the advisory area. Some power outages can be expected. The precipitation will begin to diminish later this evening. However, strong northwesterly winds will continue overnight into Sunday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches for a storm total of 2 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central, northern and southern New Hampshire and south central and western Maine. * WHEN...Until 10 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For a more precise forecast for your specific location...go to www.weather.gov/gray..

area.areaDesc: Belknap; Cheshire; Merrimack; Southern Carroll; Western And Central Hillsborough
